title: Tooltip Pattern
excerpt: Providing additional information without cluttering the interface.
content:
Tooltips are small, informative messages that appear when a user interacts with an element in a graphical user interface. They provide additional information or clarification without cluttering the main interface.

Key Features

  • Contextual information on hover or focus
  • Brief and concise content
  • Non-intrusive design

Implementation Guidelines

  1. Keep content short and to the point
  2. Position tooltips logically in relation to the trigger element
  3. Ensure tooltips are keyboard accessible
  4. Use consistent styling across your interface
  5. Consider touch interfaces in your design
